quiz.title: AP Calculus Unit 7: Optimization Problems Quiz
quiz.subtitle: Unit 7, Quiz 9: Applied Optimization in Geometry and Business
quiz.subject: AP Calculus AB/BC

questions.question: A rectangular storage container with an open top has volume 50 m³. The length of its base is twice the width. Base material costs 15 per m²; side material costs 9 per m². Which equation gives the total cost to minimize?
questions.explanation: Let width = x, length = 2x, height = h. Volume: 2x²h=50 → h=25/x². Base cost: 2x²×15=30x². Side area = 6xh, cost = 6xh×9=54xh=1350/x. Total: C=30x²+1350/x.

questions.question: A farmer fences 1.5 million ft² rectangular area, dividing it in half with a fence parallel to one side. Minimum fencing occurs when length (parallel to divider) is:
questions.explanation: Area: LW=1.5×10⁶ → W=1.5×10⁶/L. Fence length: F=2L+3W=2L+4.5×10⁶/L. Minimize: F'(L)=2−4.5×10⁶/L²=0 → L²=2.25×10⁶ → L=1500 ft.

questions.question: A cylinder inscribed in a sphere of radius 3 has maximum volume when its height is:
questions.explanation: Let cylinder radius r, half-height h: r²+h²=9. Volume V=2πr²h=2π(9−h²)h. V'(h)=2π(9−3h²)=0 → h²=3 → h=√3 → full height = 2√3.

questions.question: The point on parabola y²=2x closest to (1,4) is:
questions.explanation: Point: (y²/2,y). Distance squared D=(y²/2−1)²+(y−4)². D'(y)=y³−8=0 → y=2 → x=4/2=2. Point is (2,2).

questions.question: A Norman window (rectangle + semicircle top) has perimeter 30 ft. Maximum light area occurs when radius of semicircle is:
questions.explanation: Width=2r, height=h, perimeter: 2r+2h+πr=30 → h=15−r−πr/2. Area A=2rh+½πr². A'(r)=30−r(4+π)=0 → r=30/(4+π).

questions.question: Maximum area rectangle inscribed in ellipse x²/16+y²/9=1 has area:
questions.explanation: Vertices (±a,±b) with a²/16+b²/9=1 → b=3√(1−a²/16). Area A=4ab=12a√(1−a²/16). Maximize square: A²∝u−u²/16, derivative 1−u/8=0 → u=8 → a=2√2, b=3/√2 → Area=4ab=24.

questions.question: A 10 m wire is cut for a square and an equilateral triangle to maximize total area. Wire for square ≈:
questions.explanation: Square side s/4, area s²/16. Triangle side (10−s)/3, area √3/4 × ((10−s)/3)². Total area A=s²/16+√3(10−s)²/36. Set derivative 0: s/8−√3(10−s)/18=0 → s≈4.35 m.

questions.question: An open-top box with square base has surface area 300 cm². Maximum volume occurs with base side:
questions.explanation: Base x, height h: x²+4xh=300 → h=(300−x²)/(4x). Volume V=x²h=x(300−x²)/4. V'(x)=300−3x²=0 → x²=100 → x=10 cm.

questions.question: A closed cylindrical can holding 1 L (1000 cm³) minimizes surface area when:
questions.explanation: V=πr²h=1000 → h=1000/(πr²). Surface S=2πr²+2πrh=2πr²+2000/r. S'(r)=4πr−2000/r²=0 → r³=500/π → h=1000 r / (\pi r³) × r → h=2r → height equals diameter.

questions.question: A cone is formed by cutting a sector from a circular piece of paper of radius R and joining the edges. The cone’s slant height equals R. To maximize the cone’s volume, its base radius r is:
questions.explanation: Slant height = R, radius = r, height h = √(R² − r²). Volume V = (1/3)πr²√(R² − r²). Maximizing V² ∝ r⁴(R² − r²) yields r² = (2/3)R², so r = R√(2/3).
